DOC.brief_summary: The primary objective determine whether prolonged-release fampridine ( 10 mg twice daily ) clinically meaningful effect participant-reported walking ability 24-week study period . The secondary objective : determine whether prolonged-release fampridine 10 mg take twice daily ( BID ) clinically meaningful effect dynamic static balance , physical impact multiple sclerosis ( MS ) , upper extremity function 24-week study period ; evaluate criterion early assessment response fampridine predict clinically meaningful benefit walk ability balance ; assess safety tolerability prolonged-release fampridine 10 mg twice daily 24-week treatment period .
DOC.brief_title: Efficacy Safety Study Prolonged-Release Fampridine Participants With Multiple Sclerosis
DOC.criteria: Key Must diagnosis primaryprogressive , secondaryprogressive , progressiverelapsing , relapsingremitting MS per revise McDonald Committee criterion [ McDonald 2001 ; Polman 2005 ] define Lublin Reingold [ Lublin Reingold 1996 ] least 3 month duration Must Expanded Disability Status Scale ( EDSS ) score 4 7 , inclusive Must walk impairment , deem Investigator Key History human immunodeficiency virus ( HIV ) Presence acute chronic hepatitis . Subjects evidence prior hepatitis infection serologically confirm resolve exclude study participation Known allergy fampridine , pyridinecontaining substance , inactive ingredient prolongedrelease fampridine tablet Creatinine clearance ( CrCl ) < 80 mL/min History malignant disease Presence pulmonary disease A body mass index ( BMI ) â‰¥40 ( BMI formula : BMI = mass [ kg ] / [ height ( ) ] 2 ) NOTE : Other protocol define Inclusion/Exclusion criterion may apply .
